newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Martinair to increase cargo rates.
newsitem.headline: Martinair to increase cargo rates.

text.p: Dutch cargo and charter carrier, Martinair NV, is to increase its cargo rates from November 1, in light of increasing fuel prices, a Martinair spokesman said.
The Dutch airline will increase rates by a minimum of five percent and a maximum of ten percent, according to the route, he said.
The possibility of applying an extra fuel surcharge was dismissed as an administrative headache, he added. Therefore the carrier decided instead to implement a cargo rates increase.

Martinair has seen a 20 percent increase in fuel prices since September. The spokesman would not speculate as to whether this was because of the situation in northern Iraq or whether it relates to the U.S. use of its strategic oil reserves.
"Fuel prices are going up day by day," he added, it was impossible to keep absorbing the rises.
Martinair if jointly-owned by national Dutch airline, KLM and shipping line, Nedlloyd. -- Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
